sect1.title: Presentations and Masks
sect1.para: Presentations can be used to show the height field in other way than as false colors map of heights. Several presentation methods are implemented, including shading, gradient filters and edge detectors. It is also possible to superimpose arbitrary data field over another one as a presentation.

When you use data with superimposed presentation within data processing modules or tools the results will be computed from original data – presentation is thus only a visualization mode. Presentations can be computationaly intensive to calculate, therefore they are not automatically updated when the underlying data change.

sect1.para:
Masks are used for displaying special areal selections (e. g. grains). Masks can have any shape and within data window can be expressed by any chosen color. Masks can be created by different modules or directly by user using Mask selection tool. It it possible to invert, grow, and shrink masks, or extract them to a separate data window using module functions in
Data Process Mask
menu. There are also tools for managing masks in the main window Tools row of buttons. These can be used for creating and removing masks manually.

Several functions require a mask and they then operate on the mask and/or the data it marks, e.g. interpolation of data under mask or grain statistics (where the mask is assumed to be a result of grain marking method). Other functions allow to limit the area they operate on with masks, e.g. the statistical quantities tool or plane leveling.
Note that both the masks and presentations can be removed from data window by right-click on the displayed data and selecting appropriate command from the context menu.
